title: Bug 10403: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure and points the output folder at a bin directory, the build process does not give any warning or confirmation message.
EB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure and points the output folder at a bin directory, the build process should display a warning or confirmation message, informing the user that the bin directory will be deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
1. Create a new project for an existing directory structure.
2. Point the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files.
3. Observe if a warning or confirmation message is displayed during the build process.
